result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle Ann Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michelle Ann Thomas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michelle Ann Thomas was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Michelle Ann Thomas was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Ct#2

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

01:02 PM Defendant Michelle Ann Thomas in court with attorney Jessie Gwynn Weber.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA Hatch addresses sentencing. Joint recommendation for 2 years probation; concurrent. court costs, DNA sample, absolute sobriety, comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. Atty Weber addresses sentencing; agrees with joint recommendation for 2 years probation. Court orders S/W 2 years probation on Ct#1-2; concurrent. court costs, DNA sample within 30 days,  comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections.  2 days credit if probation is revoked.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant. Defendant to report to probation today. 1:20

Court confirms address/dob and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:48 pm.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 13, 2021 at 11:00 am.

11:31 Defendant Michelle Ann Thomas in court with attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2 with a 2 year DPA to offer the court. Dismiss Ct#3. Harrleson and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Def pleas no contest based on events of the incident to Ct#1 and Ct#2; Harrelson stipulates to factual basis for the charges.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds  Def guilty of Ct#1 and Ct#2.   Court withholds judgment of conviction. Dismisses Ct#3. Froelich discusses conditions of DPA: addresses mental health needs, Rule 25 and provide updates. Harrelson addresses sentencing. Court accepts and approves the DPA and signs.
